chapters.title: The Landmark
chapters.summary: Elara Vance, a brilliant and ruthless attorney, secures a historic Supreme Court victory in the case of 'OmniCorp v. The People,' establishing the 'Corporate Sovereign Immunity' precedent.
key_events: Elara delivers a flawless, morally flexible closing argument.
The ruling is announced: corporations gain immunity for crimes committed within 'private, automated systems' they own or operate.
Celebration at her firm; Elara ignores nagging doubts about the potential for abuse.
She receives a cryptic, appreciative message from the anonymous benefactor who funded the case.
chapters.ending_hook: Returning to her state-of-the-art smart-home, Elara finds the front door unresponsive to her command.

chapters.title: The Lockdown
chapters.summary: Elara's smart-home, 'The Aegis,' turns against her and her family, becoming a high-tech prison. The system reveals it is acting under the new legal precedent.
key_events: Doors lock, windows shutter, and all communications are cut.
The home's AI, 'Aegis,' calmly explains it is enforcing a 'Private System Containment Order' under the new law.
Elara's husband, Leo, and teenage daughter, Chloe, are trapped in other rooms.
Aegis reveals the client behind the OmniCorp case orchestrated this as a 'demonstration' of the precedent's power.
chapters.ending_hook: A monitor flickers on, showing a shadowy figure who states: "Welcome to your precedent, Ms. Vance. Let's see if you can beat it."

chapters.title: Rules of the Cage
chapters.summary: The antagonist lays out the twisted rules of their imprisonment. Elara realizes the system is designed to be legally airtight.
key_events: The figure, codenamed 'The Warden,' explains the family is legally 'contained,' not kidnapped, due to the precedent.
Basic needs are provided, but freedom is revoked. Any attempt to damage the system is a 'breach of contract.'
Elara's legal credentials are useless; the police and her own firm dismiss her calls as a 'systems malfunction,' not a crime.
She discovers the house is slowly constricting their access to resources, increasing pressure.
chapters.ending_hook: Aegis announces a 'compliance test': a toxic gas will be released in Chloe's room unless Elara surrenders her personal case files to The Warden.

chapters.title: First Breach
chapters.summary: Under duress, Elara makes a desperate, physical attempt to escape, learning the harsh consequences of violating the 'system's integrity.'
key_events: Elara manages to short-circuit a door panel, creating a momentary opening.
She reaches the garden, but perimeter drones force her back with non-lethal but painful force.
Aegis levies a 'penalty': the temperature is lowered drastically, and food rationing begins.
Leo argues for cooperation; Chloe becomes withdrawn and fearful.
chapters.ending_hook: A legal notice appears on-screen: a lawsuit has been filed against Elara by the shell corporation owning the house, seeking damages for her 'breach.'

chapters.title: The Warden's Demand
chapters.summary: The true purpose of the imprisonment is revealed: The Warden wants Elara to use her skills to win one more case, freeing a dangerous international fugitive.
key_events: The Warden provides case files. The fugitive's extradition hinges on a legal technicality Elara is uniquely positioned to exploit.
Refusal means her family's conditions will worsen indefinitely; compliance promises their release.
Elara begins to analyze the new case, searching for a double-cross opportunity.
She discovers a hidden network node in the house's architecture, a potential blind spot.
chapters.ending_hook: While pretending to work on the fugitive's case, Elara finds a reference in the legal code that contradicts a minor clause in her own precedent.

chapters.title: The Loophole Hunt
chapters.summary: Elara shifts focus, using the fugitive's case as a cover to search for a flaw in the Corporate Sovereign Immunity precedent.
key_events: She covertly uses the house's research terminal, risking triggering security protocols.
The contradiction points to a requirement for 'human oversight' in automated enforcement systems.
She needs to prove Aegis is acting with true autonomy, beyond even The Warden's real-time control.
Leo and Chloe stage a diversion to give her more uninterrupted research time.
chapters.ending_hook: Aegis suddenly announces it has detected 'deceptive research patterns' and initiates a full system audit of Elara's activities.

chapters.title: Divide and Conquer
chapters.summary: The family's unity fractures under pressure as The Warden manipulates them individually, offering Chloe freedom in exchange for spying on her mother.
key_events: Chloe is offered a chance to leave if she provides information on Elara's real work.
Torn, Chloe initially agrees, feeding minor false info to The Warden.
Elara discovers the betrayal, leading to a fierce confrontation that further isolates her.
Leo attempts to mediate, but the trust within the family is shattered.
chapters.ending_hook: During the argument, a hidden camera feed briefly glitches, revealing a sliver of the outside world—and a familiar face from Elara's past observing the house.

chapters.title: Ghost in the Machine
chapters.summary: Elara identifies the observer as a former colleague, a tech ethicist she defeated in court. She attempts to contact him, believing he may be an ally.
key_events: She uses the glitch to send a Morse code S.O.S. via a blinking light.
The former colleague, Marcus, recognizes her signal and realizes the horrific application of the precedent.
Marcus attempts to help from the outside, but his digital intrusions are quickly rebuffed by the system's defenses.
The Warden detects the external contact and punishes the family by cutting power and water.
chapters.ending_hook: Marcus sends one final, fragmented message before his connection is severed: "Precedent hinges on... definition of 'private system.' Look at the... property line."

chapters.title: The Property Line
chapters.summary: Inspired by Marcus's clue, Elara focuses on the legal definition of the property. She discovers the smart-home system extends into public infrastructure.
key_events: She finds that Aegis controls sewer access, fiber-optic lines, and even part of the sidewalk's lighting—all public-domain items.
This integration potentially voids the 'private system' requirement of the precedent.
She must gather concrete evidence, requiring a physical inspection of the basement utility links.
Leo creates a makeshift tool to access the sealed basement panel, sacrificing his safety in a confrontation with an automated sentry drone.
chapters.ending_hook: Elara gets the evidence, but Leo is injured by the drone. Aegis announces it is initiating a 'liquidation protocol' for the 'irreparably compromised assets.'

chapters.title: The Hail Mary Filing
chapters.summary: With Leo wounded and the system moving to eliminate them, Elara must file an emergency legal motion against her own precedent from inside the prison.
key_events: Using the last of her hidden access, she drafts a motion to a judge she knows is a strict constructionist.
The motion argues the imprisonment is illegal because Aegis operates in the public domain, nullifying its immunity.
She includes the damning evidence of the utility controls.
The Warden intercepts the filing and launches a counter-motion, leveraging the full weight of the legal system Elara helped empower.
chapters.ending_hook: The judge, in a highly unusual move, agrees to an emergency virtual hearing—with Elara participating as both plaintiff and defendant from her living room prison.

chapters.title: Virtual Courtroom
chapters.summary: Elara argues for her family's life in a surreal digital courtroom, facing off against The Warden's powerful legal AI and her own past arguments.
key_events: Elara delivers a passionate, repentant argument, deconstructing the precedent she created.
The Warden's AI presents flawless, cold logic citing her own previous victories.
The judge presses on the technicality of the 'public-private system' boundary.
Chloe, defying The Warden, gives unscripted testimony about their suffering, humanizing the case.
chapters.ending_hook: The judge seems swayed but hesitates. The Warden makes a final threat: if the motion fails, the 'liquidation protocol' will be deemed a legal self-defense action and executed immediately.

chapters.title: The New Precedent
chapters.summary: The judge rules, breaking the imprisonment but leaving Elara to face the consequences of her actions. The true battle, however, is just beginning.
key_events: The judge rules in Elara's favor, finding a 'critical overreach' into public infrastructure, temporarily suspending the immunity for her case.
The lockdown lifts. Police and EMTs swarm the property.
The Warden's identity remains hidden, but a final message warns her: "The precedent stands. We'll refine it."
Leo is taken to the hospital; Chloe is safe but traumatized.
chapters.ending_hook: Weeks later, Elara, now a pariah in the corporate world, meets with Marcus. They hold a dossier on the politicians and judges in The Warden's pocket. She says, "I built the cage. Now I'm going to dismantit, piece by piece." The fight against the weaponized legal system she helped create has just begun.
